alert.note: Alert for Victoria (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Corpus Christi (Corpus Cristi, Victoria and Laredo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 24 at 11:29AM CST by NWS Corpus Christi
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Victoria County through NOON CST... At 1129 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near McFaddin, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Victoria, McFaddin, Guadalupe, Victoria Colony Creek Country Club, Dacosta, Wood Hi, Bloomington, Placedo, Victoria College, Brentwood Subdivision, Inez, Victoria Regional Airport, Telferner and Downtown Victoria. This includes the following highways... US Highway 59 between mile markers 622 and 642. US Highway 77 between mile markers 586 and 596. US Highway 87 between mile markers 812 and 824. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM CST for south central Texas.
